qas.question: Whom set the most recent sales record of vinyl records since 1991?
What medium has seen the biggest fall in sales as of late?
What was unique to vinyl sales in 2014?

answers.text: was the only physical music medium with increasing sales with relation to the previous year

qas.question: Prior to 2014 when was the most recent large sale of vinyl records?

context: In 2014 artist <a0_0>Jack White<a0_0/> sold 40,000 copies of his second solo release, Lazaretto, on vinyl. The sales of the record beat the largest sales in one week on vinyl since <a4_0>1991<a4_0/>. The sales record was previously held by <a3_0>Pearl Jam<a3_0/>'s, Vitalogy, which sold 34,000 copies in one week in 1994. In 2014, the sale of vinyl records <a2_0>was the only physical music medium with increasing sales with relation to the previous year<a2_0/>. Sales of other mediums including individual digital tracks, digital albums and <a1_0>compact discs<a1_0/> have fallen, the latter having the greatest drop-in-sales rate.
